intro: Loasa bryoniifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf loasa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
